solver

Class Z3Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • solver.Z3Context
      • solver.Z3Solver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SolverFunctions
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClusterMutExclNonPipelined, ClusterMutExclPipelined, GenericPartitionSolver, GenericPlacementSolver, MappingCommSolver, MatrixSolver, MutualExclusionSolver, UnfoldingScheduling

    public abstract class Z3Solver
extends Z3Context
implements SolverFunctions
    Expose the Z3 Solver to our framework.
    Author:
    Pranav Tendulkar

      • z3Solver

        Z3 Solver Instance.

      • enableStatementStack

        private boolean enableStatementStack
        For every statement that we assert, we can save it on our own stack to generate the output file.

      • contextStatements

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> contextStatements
        We save all the assertions on this stack. Use this to generate a Z3 solver file. TODO: we use push and pop alternatively so this works. otherwise we must have list> and more complex logic.

      • pushedContext

        protected boolean pushedContext
        Context pushed on the stack? Next thing to do will be a pop.

        Number of statements asserted after context pushed.

      • addVariableDeclaration

        public com.microsoft.z3.Expr addVariableDeclaration(java.lang.String variableName,
                                           java.lang.String variableType)
        Declare a variable in Z3 context. We save the variable declaration for generation of the output z3 file. By default, I think it is not saved in the context.
        Parameters:
        variableName - name of the variable
        variableType - type of the variable
        Returns:
        Expression representing the variable.

      • setTacTicSolver

        public void setTacTicSolver(java.lang.String[] tacticNames)
        Instead of default solver, we would want to use tactic solver. We apply one tactic after another. However, we can have some advanced tactic application. Its not done yet.
        Parameters:
        tacticNames - name of the tactics for the solver.

      • generateSatCode

        public void generateSatCode(java.lang.String fileName)
        Generate a Z3 file with all the constraints in it. We can use this file to check the same problem by using Z3 on command line.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the output file including the path
